bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 99 (Wednesday, June 7, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. ESPAILLAT:H.R. 3902.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 1The Congress shall have Power to . . . provide for the . .. general Welfare of the United States; . . .The single subject of this legislation is:This bill would create a set aside in the UAIP grant forSocially Disadvantaged Farmers and Ranchers[Page H2780]

item.title: Growing Opportunities for Innovative Farming Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.

bill.title: Growing Opportunities for Innovative Farming Act

item.title: Growing Opportunities for Innovative Farming Act
Growing Opportunities for Innovative Farming Act

To amend the Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994 to provide for a set-aside for socially disadvantaged farmers and ranchers for grants to support urban agriculture and innovative production, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
